TXU adds to wind-power portfolio



May 16--TXU Wholesale, already the state's largest purchaser of wind-generated electricity, said Tuesday it signed a five-year contract to buy all the power from a 209-megawatt wind farm southwest of Abilene.  The agreement with Chicago-based Airtricity North America will boost TXU's wind-power portfolio to 914 megawatts of electrici- ty from 965 turbines, including those at Airtricity's Ros- coe ...

Low-impact paper, high profile: Mohawk says investment in environmental projects makes premium lines "carbon neutral"



May 16--COHOES -- Mohawk Fine Papers Inc.'s premium sheets include such shades as mahogany, ocean mist, desert haze, eucalyptus and balm.  But starting today, all that high-end paper will come in one color: green. That's green in the environmental sense, since the company has made its premium line "carbon neutral." Power outage hits Wesley Medical Center



May 15--A short circuit in one of Wesley Medical Center's main power systems has knocked out electricity at the hospital.  The short, which occurred at about 5:15 a.m. today, was initially thought to be a lightning strike from thunderstorms pounding the city at the time because people heard a pop, hospital spokeswoman Helen Thomas said. The hospital is using generators to provide electricity to ...

EDITORIAL: KeySpan cleanup: It's past time to remediate MGP sites



May 15--The cleanup of contaminated soil at sites where gas was last produced more than a half-century ago has been on the back burner far too long. So it's good that the heat is getting turned up under KeySpan Corp., as it seeks state approval of its takeover by National Grid Plc.  The point of the pressure, however, should be a timetable for addressing the worst sites quickly and economically, ...

-- TXU Wholesale announced it has increased its portfolio of wind power contracts with a 209 MW agreement with Airtricity, a renewable energy company based in Dublin, Ireland. Canada should seize challenge of clean coal



OTTAWA - In basic ways, Alex Fassbender's breakthrough in clean-coal technology retains James Watt's methodology from the 18th century. You pulverize coal into particles as fine as talcum powder, then burn it in a furnace surrounded by pipes filled with water. You direct the steam into turbines that spin to produce electricity. In other basic ways, though, it is very different.

Half the population are paying up to 250 a year more for their gas and electricity because the power companies know they will never switch supplier, it was claimed yesterday.A report by the Centre for Competition Policy at the University of East Anglia concluded that a lack of competition in the market is effectively allowing the six big power firms to keep bills artificially high for the 50% of ...

Analysis: Venezuela takes over oil rigs
